intro: Ceraia inconspicua, commonly known as the common ceria, is a small flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in shrubland or woodland habitats. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Ceraia inconspicua is relatively hardy and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
